intro: Clausenellia, commonly known as the "buttercup grass," is a genus of flowering plants in the family Poaceae. It is characterized by its delicate, grass-like appearance with narrow, blade-like leaves and small, inconspicuous flowers. The plant typically grows in wet or marshy habitats, preferring moist soil conditions. Clausenellia species are often found in temperate regions and are adapted to thrive in environments with high humidity. Its botanical features make it an important component of wetland ecosystems.
